intro: Pilopleura goloskokovii, commonly known as the Siberian bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the cold climates of Siberia and northern regions of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant features showy, blue to purple bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a basal rosette. Pilopleura goloskokovii is adapted to harsh environments, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun.
